data.title: 准备以至少 30 秒的时间回答以下问题
data.subject: Talk about telling a lie.
data.answer: At a young age, many of us are taught that telling a lie is absolutely wrong. Yet as we grow up, we slowly become exposed to small "white" lies — those told to keep us from becoming upset or sad. Even as we transition into adulthood, well-meaning lies are often told to shield a person from criticism or added hardship. So it is not always wrong to tell a lie. There are times when a white lie seems to be the least offensive thing to say. For example, someone gives you a gift you don't like. Do you say you don't like it or something such as: "Thanks for the thoughtful gift?" However, if every lie told could prevent harm to another person, without any ill-effects, or even can save someone's life, it would make the answer to this question more clear that a lie is definitely worth it. （149 字）

options.content: Is it always wrong to tell a lie?
Would you lie in order to save someone's life?
